member.name: T:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.AsynchronousAttribute
member.summary: Mark the test method as one which expects asynchronous execution. It is important to call TestComplete() once it is ready or your test will never continue/timeout.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.BugAttribute
member.summary:
An attribute that contains known bug information that can be logged during a unit test run.
When applied to a test method, it will invert the result. This makes it possible to perform automated runs and continuous integration while validating and tracking known issues.
The attribute should have the Fixed bool set to True, or be removed, once the issue is resolved.

member.summary: Construct a new BugAttribute with no bug description.

member.summary: Construct a new BugAttribute with a bug description.

member.summary: Return the bug information.
member.returns: Known issue as a string.

member.summary: Gets the bug description.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.BugAttribute.Fixed
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the known issue has been fixed. If it has, the attribute is ignored and will not affect test results.

member.summary: A counter of the hit blocks.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.CodeCoverage.GetCoverageData
member.summary: Get the coverage data serialized as a string for easy transport.
member.remarks: Previous releases of the framework used a simplistic bit list, this release updates the coverage reporting endpoint to an alternate version that ends in base 64. This maintains test runner compatibility with previous official releases.
member.returns: Coverage data serialized as a string.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.CodeCoverage.HitBlockCount
member.summary: Gets the current number of hit blocks.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.CodeCoverage.BlockCount
member.summary: Gets the current size of the blocks counter. This is not actually the number of hit blocks, but it should return 0 always except when at least one block is hit.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.CustomFrameworkUnitTest
member.summary:
Base class for test cases that use special functionality of the Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing unit test framework.
Tests that derive from CustomTest in most cases will not be source- or functionality- compatible with the more advanced desktop Visual Studio Test Team environment and harnesses.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.Harness.TagManager.ExpressionEvaluator
member.summary: Evaluate tag expressions.
member.remarks:
Tag expressions are derived from the following EBNF grammar: {Expression} := {Expression} + {Term} | {Expression} - {Term} | {Term} {Term} := {Term} * {Factor} | {Factor} {Factor} := !{Factor} | ({Expression}) | {Tag} {Tag} := All | [^InvalidCharacters]+
The non-terminals for {Expression} and {Term} will be left factored in the recursive descent parser below.

member.summary: Union character.

member.summary: Complement character.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.Harness.TagManager.ExpressionEvaluator.Difference
member.summary: Difference character.

member.summary: The "All" string constant.

member.summary: Invalid characters in a tag name.

member.summary: Evaluate a tag expression.

member.summary: Evaluate an expression.

member.summary: Evaluate a term.

member.summary: Evaluate a term.
member.param: Left term already read as part of the expression.
member.returns: Test methods described by the expression.
member.remarks: Non-terminal created for left-factoring: {Term'} := #empty# ^ {Factor}{Term'}

member.summary: Evaluate a factor.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.WorkItemExtensions
member.summary: A class contains extension methods and helpers for dealing with WorkItem instances and improving framework performance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.WorkItemExtensions.EnqueueQuickWorkItem(Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.WorkItemTest,Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.WorkItem)
member.summary: Enqueues a work item into the task queue. The work item will run immediately following the previous work item, and may not leave any time before executing the next. This is a specialized method to be used for performance improvements.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.WorkItemExtensions.EnqueueQuickCallback(Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.WorkItemTest,System.Action)
member.summary: Enqueues a method into the task queue. The method will run immediately following the previous work item, and may not leave any time before executing the next. This is a specialized method to be used for performance improvements.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.WorkItemExtensions.EnqueueQuickConditional(Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.WorkItemTest,System.Func{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Enqueues a conditional statement into the task queue. The method will run immediately following the previous work item, and may not leave any time before executing the next. This is a specialized method to be used for performance improvements.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.WorkItemTest
member.summary:
Custom test class that provides the ability to perform semi-asynchronous test tasks on the main thread. Requires the custom unit test harness that manages and invokes test work items on the thread when needed.
Tests using this functionality will not be compatible with the full desktop framework's Visual Studio Team Test environment.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.WorkItemTest.TestComplete
member.summary:
Signal that a test is complete when using Async testing.
WARNING: If you use your own methods for completing, such as an HtmlTimer or other threading method, it is possible that this call will occur *AFTER* the test has timed out when using Timeouts. As such, be very careful as you could complete the call to the *next* test.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.WorkItemTest.EnqueueWorkItem(Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.WorkItem)
member.summary:
Add a task object to the test queue. For a test that is currently executing, all tasks contained within the queue are executed to completion (unless an Exception is thrown) -before- moving on to the next test.
The test task queue replaces the PumpMessages(...) system that permitted a single callback. This enables specialized tasks, such as DOM bridge tasks, sleep tasks, and conditional continue tasks.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.WorkItemTest.EnqueueDelay(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Delay a minimum amount of time before continuing. Similar to a sleep call that is not a blocking call.
member.param: The minimum time span to wait before continuing.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.WorkItemTest.CreateDelay(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Creates a delay work item instance.
member.param: The minimum time span to wait before continuing.
member.returns: Returns a new work item.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.WorkItemTest.EnqueueDelay(System.Double)
member.summary: Delay a minimum amount of time before continuing. Similar to a sleep call that is not a blocking call.
member.param: The minimum number of milliseconds to wait until the delay is finished.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.WorkItemTest.EnqueueConditional(System.Func{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Requires a bool returning delegate to be passed in. Instructs the test task queue to wait until the conditional call returns True to continue executing other test tasks and/or ending the test method.
member.param: Conditional method or delegate. Test will halt until this condition returns True.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.WorkItemTest.CreateConditional(System.Func{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Creates a conditional work item instance.
member.param: Conditional method or delegate. Test will halt until this condition returns True.
member.returns: Returns a new work item.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.WorkItemTest.EnqueueTestComplete
member.summary: Enqueue a test task which calls the TestComplete method of SilverlightTest.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.WorkItemTest.EnqueueCallback(System.Action)
member.summary: Add a Callback method into the test task queue. Similar to the PumpMessages(...) call, with the difference being that there is no longer a single requirement: you can enqueue several callback methods and other test tasks, all of which will execute before the test completes and/or the engine continues.
member.param: Void-returning delegate, anonymous delegates work fine too.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.WorkItemTest.CreateCallback(System.Action)
member.summary: Creates a callback work item instance.
member.param: Void-returning delegate, anonymous delegates work fine too.
member.returns: Returns a new work item.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.WorkItemTest.EnqueueCallback(System.Action[])
member.summary: Adds a number of callback methods into the test task queue.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.WorkItemTest.Sleep(System.Int32,System.Action)
member.summary: Sleep a minimum number of milliseconds before calling a test callback delegate.
member.param: Minimum number of milliseconds to sleep. The only guarantee to the tester is that the sleep will be >= this amount of ms, and NOT that there is precision or an exact time.
Callback method to execute after the minimum amount of time has elapsed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.WorkItemTest.Enqueue(System.Action)
member.summary: Enqueue an action. A shortcut for the EnqueueCallback.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.WorkItemTest.EnqueueSleep(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sleep a minimum number of milliseconds. This is the simplified overload which requires no callback.
member.param: Minimum number of milliseconds to sleep. The only guarantee to the tester is that the sleep will be >= this amount of ms, and NOT that there is precision or an exact time.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.ExclusiveAttribute
member.summary:
A special indicator attribute to enable better debugging using Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.
As there is very little parameter information available for a test run, this attribute singles out specific classes to execute when found.
This attribute is unique to this environment and not compatible with any desktop unit test framework without using a shim if it is left in code.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.PresentationTest
member.summary:
Implementation of useful properties and features for presentation platform tests (Silverlight and WPF).
Tests using this functionality will not be compatible with the full desktop framework's Visual Studio Team Test environment.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.PresentationTest.TestPanel
member.summary: Gets the test panel.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.SilverlightTest
member.summary:
Provides access to Silverlight-specific test features and functionality.
Tests using this functionality will not be compatible with the full desktop framework's Visual Studio Team Test environment.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.WorkItem
member.summary:
A test work item is a task that is invoked until it is complete. It maintains its own state to be able to notify the caller when it is finally complete, with no further work to be run.
It is possible that some implementations of a TestWorkItem may actually contain a set of sub-tasks by implementing a composite pattern.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.WorkItem._canExecuteImmediately
member.summary: A value indicating whether the task can immediately execute.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.WorkItem.Invoke
member.summary: Invoke the task. Return false only when the task is complete.
member.returns: True if there is additional work to be completed. False when there is none.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.WorkItem.WorkItemComplete

member.name: T:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.Harness.DecoratorDictionary
member.summary:
A dictionary that can store just about any kind of object, keyed off any object. As a Hashtable, it permits using keys of - enums - objects - types
This makes it ideal for use in decorating and adorning special types in the system, such as log messages.
A strongly-typed decorator key could come from an enum value, while a prototype extension to the test system could simply use a string key for organizing.
In all instances, the resulting object needs to be cast appropriately.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.Harness.DecoratorDictionary.HasDecorator(System.Object)
member.summary: Check if a decorator exists.
member.returns: Returns a value indicating whether the decorator key exists. Even if the key exists, the instance value for the key could be set to null, yielding a null instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.Harness.DecoratorDictionary.HasDecorators(System.Object[])
member.summary: Check if a set of decorators exists.
member.param: The set of decorator(s) of interest.
member.returns: Returns a value indicating whether the decorators of interest were present.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.Harness.DecoratorDictionary.GetDecorator(System.Object)
member.summary: Retrieves the decorator instance if it exists. If not, this method returns null.
member.returns: Returns the instance or null if it does not exist. No exceptions are thrown in this method.

member.summary: The threshold used to determine whether two clicks are temporally local and considered a double click (or triple, quadruple, etc.). 500 milliseconds is the default double click value on Windows. This value would ideally be pulled form the system settings.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.Controls.InteractionHelper.SequentialClickThresholdInPixelsSquared
member.summary: The threshold used to determine whether two clicks are spatially local and considered a double click (or triple, quadruple, etc.) in pixels squared. We use pixels squared so that we can compare to the distance delta without taking a square root.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.Controls.InteractionHelper._updateVisualState
member.summary: Reference used to call UpdateVisualState on the base class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.Controls.InteractionHelper.#ctor(System.Windows.Controls.Control)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the InteractionHelper class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Silverlight.Testing.Controls.InteractionHelper.UpdateVisualState(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Update the visual state of the control.
member.param: A value indicating whether to automatically generate transitions to the new state, or instantly transition to the new state.
member.remarks: UpdateVisualState works differently than the rest of the injected functionality. Most of the other events are overridden by the calling class which calls Allow, does what it wants, and then calls Base. UpdateVisualState is the opposite because a number of the methods in InteractionHelper need to trigger it in the calling class. We do this using the IUpdateVisualState internal interface.

member.summary: Update the visual state of the control.
member.param: A value indicating whether to automatically generate transitions to the new state, or instantly transition to the new state.
